# Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Program - CAPMoN Kejimkujik Site

## Background
Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) is seeking a contractor to provide daily technical support at the CAPMoN Kejimkujik National Park site in Nova Scotia. The site operates as part of ECCC's national network of CAPMoN stations, collecting precipitation and air samples for environmental research and monitoring.

## Objectives
The contractor will be responsible for servicing daily collecting instruments, including precipitation collectors, air samplers, and ozone samplers. The contractor will retrieve and process samples according to established procedures, packaging and shipping them to designated laboratories for analysis.

## Scope of Work
The contractor will be responsible for:

* Servicing precipitation collectors, air filter sampling systems, ozone sampling systems, Total Gaseous Mercury Systems, Mercury in Precipitation Measurements, and Ammonia Monitoring Network (AMoN) Passive Sampler Measurements
* Packaging and shipping samples to designated laboratories
* Performing routine site maintenance, including keeping the sampling hut clean, clearing snow from the stairs and deck, and maintaining grass at an acceptable height
* Conducting first-level maintenance, diagnostics, and minor repairs to equipment

## Service Period
The contractor will provide daily technical support 7 days per week, 52 weeks per year. The contract operator is required to be on-site at the Kejimkujik site, with access to sensitive and expensive research and monitoring equipment.

## Additional Requirements
ECCC may require the contractor to perform unforeseen work and emergency repairs on an as-needed basis.
